timeline.message: WIP supporting packages for test utilities
Correct name and use star/unstar to test workflow

timeline.bodyText: What version of common is this? Looks very old
timeline.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: Good catch.  I'm going to point this to 0.0.+.  Using 0.0. to ensure that no one tries to ship one of these.
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: but why are we not using the latest? (3.0.4)
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: I thought 0.0 made it clear that this isn't intended to be used... in any production scenario.
replies.author: shoatman

timeline.bodyText: I'm not clear on what is happening here?
timeline.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: This is the version file that we've been using to actually version things.  The versionName shouldn't be set to this, but I'll change before merging.  I'll write up some documentation to go along with this PR.
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: I know the file....I don't understand what these ^M symbols are meant to do
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText: and why the version is down to from 3.0.5 to 0.0.26
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.message: switch to feature branch for testing

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            # Jobs run in parrelel by default.  Use "needs:" to indicate dependencies run sequentially
          
          
            
            # Jobs run in parallel by default.  Use "needs:" to indicate dependencies run sequentially
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -3,18 +3,41 @@ name: dev_updated
 
 # Controls when the action will run. Triggers the workflow on push or pull request
 # events but only for the dev branch
+#on:
+#  push:
+#    branches: [ dev ]
+
 on:
-  push:
-    branches: [ dev ]
+  watch:
+    types: [started]
+    branches: [android/package-test-utilities]
 
-# A workflow run is made up of one or more jobs that can run sequentially or in parallel
+# Jobs run in parrelel by default.  Use "needs:" to indicate dependencies run sequentially

timeline.message: fix common dependency for testutils and reset current version to match current in repo

timeline.bodyText: Ah, windows newlines versus unix newlines.
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: ohhh this is a newline? I was confused about what this was for too long
replies.author: shahzaibj

replies.bodyText:
ohhh this is a newline? I was confused about what this was for too long

I saw that, so I commented to clarify. ;-)
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: I assume you're referring to type coercion, but not sure i'm following in this case.  getLatestPatchVersion returns an integer or it throws an exception and would fail the script.
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText:
I assume you're referring to type coercion, but not sure i'm following in this case. getLatestPatchVersion returns an integer or it throws an exception and would fail the script.

I'm just wondering about the case where that file is empty or doesn't exist.  We implicitly accept that earlier.  I'd rather fail there.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: I didn't write that code, and i'd like to avoid refactoring something that doesn't have any record of being broken.
replies.author: shoatman

timeline.bodyText: explode if you can't find it, pls, and tell people why (this environment variable and this property were both empty, could not find access token to talk to foo).  Bonus points, include information about what scopes and organizations that access token needs to be able to work.  You're new and you're running this.  You should be able to remediate based on the output.
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,4 +1,42 @@
-apply plugin: 'java-library'
+plugins {
+    id 'java-library'
+    id 'maven-publish'
+}
+
+apply from: '../common/versioning/version_tasks.gradle'
+
+project.ext.vstsUsername = System.getenv("ENV_VSTS_MVN_ANDROIDCOMMON_USERNAME") != null ? System.getenv("ENV_VSTS_MVN_ANDROIDCOMMON_USERNAME") : project.findProperty("vstsUsername")
+project.ext.vstsPassword = System.getenv("ENV_VSTS_MVN_ANDROIDCOMMON_ACCESSTOKEN") != null ? System.getenv("ENV_VSTS_MVN_ANDROIDCOMMON_ACCESSTOKEN") : project.findProperty("vstsMavenAccessToken")

replies.bodyText: This bit of code is in multiple projects.  If we're going to do this i'd want to do it at once for all projects... probably when i upgrade to latest gradle plugin.  Are you ok with leaving this as is for now?
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText:
This bit of code is in multiple projects. If we're going to do this i'd want to do it at once for all projects... probably when i upgrade to latest gradle plugin. Are you ok with leaving this as is for now?

Yes.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

timeline.bodyText: This seems to do the same thing in both cases.  Am I missing something?  I am.  There's an extra common if the file exists.
timeline.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: I think so... the path is different.
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: Yup.  So one will cover common as part of android-complete, and the other as part of common.  I wonder that this shouldn't be parameterized to work with all the other packages.  But a comment would be nice.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: I was consider writing a document to cover gradle project composability.  To be honest I think the design of this can be improved.  Again since the same code is in multiple projects i'll take this a feedback for my next update of everything referenced by Android-complete.  Would be interested to see an example of what you're thinking about in terms of parameterization.
replies.author: shoatman

replies.bodyText: So if this becomes a reusable activity that you can just add to your flow, then $rootDir/$versionFile, I would thing, where versionFile is in the workflow instance definition.
replies.author: AdamBJohnsonx

replies.bodyText: Yep.  We can design something better here.  Sounds like a fun hackathon project.
replies.author: shoatman
